physical_examinations.vital_signs: Tourniquet applied at 350 mmHg for 80 minutes
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Painless common peroneal nerve palsy noted immediately postoperatively; no active function in the tibialis anterior and sensation in the common peroneal nerve distribution remained abnormal.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At nine months post-repair, little clinical improvement was observed but electromyography showed signs of early reinnervation. At fifteen months post-repair, normal strength in the hamstrings was noted but peroneal muscle strength decreased by 50% compared to the uninjured limb.
